revised_title: King Alfred's Antiquity: A Curious Piece of Gold Found in Somersetshire
tldr: Dr. Musgrave shares information about a gold artifact found in Somersetshire, possibly belonging to King Alfred. The artifact features intricate engravings and is covered in enamel and crystal. It is speculated that this piece might have been an amulet worn by the king.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
